meanings.sent1: The bioequivalences of the two medications were confirmed by the researchers.
meanings.sent2: Doctors rely on bioequivalences to ensure the effectiveness of generic drugs.
meanings.sent3: The bioequivalences of the vitamins had a party in the body, all feeling equally important.
meanings.sent4: In the world of medicine, bioequivalences are like twins, identical in function.
meanings.sent5: Understanding bioequivalences is crucial for safe and accurate drug prescribing.

meanings.definition: The quality of having the same bioavailability when compared to a reference product.
meanings.sent1: Pharmaceutical companies strive for bioequivalences in their generic versions.
meanings.sent2: The bioequivalences of the new drug were tested against the original brand.
meanings.sent3: The bioequivalences of the supplements were so similar, they could be mistaken for siblings.
meanings.sent4: Achieving bioequivalences is like hitting a bullseye in the world of drug development.
meanings.sent5: The concept of bioequivalences ensures consistent drug effects for patients.
